title: Functions and Graphs
content:
What is a Function?# A function maps each input to exactly one output. We write this as $f(x)$.
Linear Functions# A linear function has the form:
$$f(x) = mx + c$$
Where $m$ is the gradient and $c$ is the y-intercept.
Quadratic Functions# A quadratic function has the form:
$$f(x) = ax^2 + bx + c$$
The quadratic formula gives us the roots:
$$x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}$$
Practice Questions# Find the gradient of $f(x) = 3x + 5$ Solve $x^2 - 5x + 6 = 0$ using the quadratic formula Sketch the graph of $f(x) = x^2 - 4$
